docs.abstract: The Pentagon is a microcosm of the inherent contradictions in how companies, government agencies and people across the country are trying to deal with the coronavirus.
docs.snippet: The Pentagon is a microcosm of the inherent contradictions in how companies, government agencies and people across the country are trying to deal with the coronavirus.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At the Pentagon, figuring out how to respond to the coronavirus has been a stop-and-go mission.

headline.main: Canceled War Games. Video Meetings. The Military Guards Against Coronavirus.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

byline.original: By Helene Cooper and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

docs.abstract: He described the dangers of “a horrible infection” during an address whose inaccuracies required immediate clarification.
docs.snippet: He described the dangers of “a horrible infection” during an address whose inaccuracies required immediate clarification.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Sitting somberly behind the Resolute Desk in the Oval Office, framed by his custom gold curtains, President Trump for the first time on Wednesday night acknowledged the seriousness of the coronavirus.

headline.main: In Rare Oval Office Speech, Trump Voices New Concerns and Old Themes
headline.print_headline: In a Rare Oval Office Address, New Concerns and Familiar Themes

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: Captains of the ship or trapped in a petri dish? As reality sets in at the Capitol about the risks of a growing pandemic, Congress continues to meet.
docs.snippet: Captains of the ship or trapped in a petri dish? As reality sets in at the Capitol about the risks of a growing pandemic, Congress continues to meet.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As fears mounted this week about the rapid spread of the coronavirus, Speaker Nancy Pelosi swatted away the suggestion of shuttering Congress with a stoic declaration: “We are the captains of the ship. We are the last to leave.”

headline.main: ‘Don’t Panic’: Fear and Loathing Grip Congress as Coronavirus Spreads

docs.abstract: The president and his advisers are considering using emergency funds to bolster the economy.
docs.snippet: The president and his advisers are considering using emergency funds to bolster the economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump took his pitch for a coronavirus-related economic stimulus package to Capitol Hill on Tuesday, joining Senate Republicans over lunch to discuss cutting payroll taxes, offering targeted relief to tourism and hospitality industries, and other possible steps to lift economic growth.

headline.main: Trump Pitches Coronavirus-Related Stimulus Package on Capitol Hill

byline.original: By Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

docs.abstract: The case is the court’s latest consideration of the constitutionality of harsh punishments for youthful offenders.
docs.snippet: The case is the court’s latest consideration of the constitutionality of harsh punishments for youthful offenders.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court agreed on Monday to decide whether judges must determine that juvenile offenders are incorrigible before sentencing them to die in prison. The case, involving a teenager who killed his grandfather, is the latest in a series of cases on the constitutionality of harsh punishments for youths who commit crimes before they turn 18.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Consider When Juveniles May Get Life Without Parole
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Will Weigh Role of Incorrigibility in Sentencing of Young Offenders

docs.abstract: The decision is a victory for Congress’s power to obtain information for an impeachment inquiry. The Trump administration is likely to appeal.
docs.snippet: The decision is a victory for Congress’s power to obtain information for an impeachment inquiry. The Trump administration is likely to appeal.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House has a right to see secret grand-jury evidence gathered in the Russia investigation, an appeals court ruled on Tuesday in a victory for Congress’s power to gather information for an impeachment inquiry.

headline.main: House Can See Mueller’s Secret Grand Jury Evidence, Appeals Court Rules
headline.print_headline: House Can See Evidence Of Mueller Grand Jury, An Appeals Court Rules

docs.abstract: The president’s comments could derail a bipartisan deal to extend three F.B.I. tools for national security investigations. They expire Sunday.
docs.snippet: The president’s comments could derail a bipartisan deal to extend three F.B.I. tools for national security investigations. They expire Sunday.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Three F.B.I. tools for investigating terrorism and espionage will expire at least temporarily on Sunday after President Trump suggested on Thursday that he might veto a bipartisan surveillance bill to extend them and the Senate left town without voting on it.

headline.main: Surveillance Tools Will Lapse as Trump Signals Possible Veto
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Tools Will Lapse as Trump Signals He May Veto Bipartisan Bill

docs.abstract: American warplanes hit weapons storage facilities in southern Iraq in a strike intended to destroy rockets like the ones fired at U.S. and British troops on Wednesday.
docs.snippet: American warplanes hit weapons storage facilities in southern Iraq in a strike intended to destroy rockets like the ones fired at U.S. and British troops on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — United States warplanes struck five targets in southern Iraq on Thursday night, hitting back at an Iraqi militia with ties to Iran that is believed to have been part of a rocket attack on Wednesday that killed two Americans and a British soldier, American officials said.

headline.main: U.S. Carries Out Retaliatory Strikes on Iranian-Backed Militia in Iraq
headline.print_headline: U.S. Strikes Iraq Militias After Attack That Killed 3

byline.original: By Eric Schmitt and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

docs.abstract: The vice president said the C.D.C. had lifted all restrictions on testing for the virus and would be releasing new guidelines to fast-track testing.
docs.snippet: The vice president said the C.D.C. had lifted all restrictions on testing for the virus and would be releasing new guidelines to fast-track testing.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Vice President Mike Pence said the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention had lifted all restrictions on testing for the coronavirus and would be releasing new guidelines to fast-track testing for people who fear they have the virus, even if they are displaying mild symptoms.

headline.main: Any American Can Now Be Tested for the Coronavirus, Pence Says
headline.print_headline: Any American Can Now Be Tested for the Coronavirus, Pence Says

byline.original: By Noah Weiland, Katie Rogers and Emily Cochrane

docs.abstract: President Trump appeared eager to bask in the warm reception of a conservative audience, who spent the conference listening to speakers road-testing messages for his re-election campaign.
docs.snippet: President Trump appeared eager to bask in the warm reception of a conservative audience, who spent the conference listening to speakers road-testing messages for his re-election campaign.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump crouched underneath his microphone on Saturday, mimicking the height of Michael R. Bloomberg, the billionaire former mayor of New York City who is running for president.

headline.main: At CPAC, Trump Takes Aim at Rivals
headline.print_headline: Trump Heaps Scorn on Rivals and Praise on Himself at CPAC
